com.epic.autoplayer
Class AutoPlayer

java.lang.Object
  com.epic.autoplayer.AutoPlayer

public class AutoPlayer
extends java.lang.Object

Main class responsible to start the PlayerResquestListener socket server that listen on port 8080 to receive the for the URLs of the videos that must be exhibited. Once a URL is received by the server, it is enqueued to be played later by the VideoPlayer class. The VideoPlayer class the instantiated and loops infinitely checking for new enqueued videos to be played. Once a new video URL is enqueued, the VideoPlayer will download it (if not downloaded yet) to the path defined in MEMORY_CARD_PATH and exhibit it using the video player command line configured in PLAYER_CMD.

Author:
Rodrigo Vargas

Field Detail

DEFAULT_LISTEN_PORT

private static int DEFAULT_LISTEN_PORT
Holds the default port used by PlayerRequestListener socket server, responsible to receive requests of that must be displayed.

DEFAULT_MEMORY_CARD_PATH

private static java.lang.String DEFAULT_MEMORY_CARD_PATH
Holds the default path where the internal memory card is mounted. It is used to save the videos locally prior displaying it.

DEFAULT_PLAYER_CMD

private static java.lang.String DEFAULT_PLAYER_CMD
Holds the default command line that executes the video player to display the video. The command line must contains all switches required to display the movie in full screen, and make the player exit after the video finishes. The command line must contain <filename> place holder to indicate where in the command line the path to the file to be executed must be inserted.

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Starts a new thread for PlayerRequestListener, in order to wait for new requests of movies to be displayed and starts the VideoPlayer to download and play any video that is enqueued.
